author: Jay Greene
title: Dropbox Revenue Increases as It Lands More Paying Users - WSJ
text:
Dropbox Inc. added about half a million paying customers in the first quarter, helping the data-storage provider increase revenue by 28% in its first financial report as a publicly traded company.
While anyone can use Dropbox free, the companyâ€™s growth is contingent on getting people to sign up for premium tools. At the end of the quarter, Dropbox had 11.5 million paying users, up about 24% from a year ago.
